    • Method Detail

      • step

        public boolean step()
        Description copied from class: AbstractSearch
        Performs a single step in the search. The method returns true if a move has been performed. When the method returns false one can expect that any further call to step will not move the searcher from the current solution. This is particularly useful to interrupt a loop that calls step: 
        
 while(search.step());

        An implementation of this interface could also include an iteration counter and set an iteration limit. The implementation must then also check that if the maximum number of iterations has been reached a call to step will just return false and not perform a move.

        Moves do not necessarily have to improve the best solution.

        Specified by:
        step in class AbstractSearch<M,​S>
        Returns:
        true when a move has been done.
